content.body: hi all! the State of HTML 2025 survey results are now published: https://2025.stateofhtml.com/en-US/
sideshowbarker: HTML's "same origin" I think should generally have a hyphen
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: HTML's "same origin" I think should generally have a hyphen

content.body: yup. It’s always an adjective. And to somebody who isn’t already read-up on web-platform terminology, “same origin policy” more likely is going just be (mis)read as “having an origin policy that is the same” — rather than a “policy that is about stuff that has the same origin”
